posts.cooked:
Hello y’all,

Our team has been on the swerve journey over the last year and we now have it working relatively well, with the exception of a few issues like the robot consistently drifting off to the right slightly while driving forward, which we’re looking into.

The largest issue now is PathPlanner implementation. For reference, here is our code repository . We’ve never used PathPlanner before, and we’d like to use it for auto this year.

Our software versions are as follows: WPILib: 2024.1.1 PathPlanner: v2024.1.2 PathPlannerLib: v2024.1.3 All other software and firmware has been updated to their latest versions.

After reading the PathPlanner Getting Started page , we put the AutoBuilder configuration in our SwerveSubsystem file:

Then in RobotContainer , we put this for the auto:

As far as PathPlanner goes, this is what we’ve got: image 1266×713 23.2 KB

image 1266×713 23.2 KB

image 1266×713 23.2 KB

We just have Auto1 which has nothing but Path1 , no events or anything.

The resulting action when running this is the robot accelerating quickly to it’s forward-right direction. The floor on which it ran was very smooth and due to it’s rapid acceleration, it skidded a ton which I’m sure is not helping. My main concern is why is it going in that direction every time? I’ve also tried rotating the robot to check if it’s a weird gyro issue but it is always relative to the robot. I’d love to learn the in’s and out’s of PathPlanner and how teams have overcome these issues before.

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
SirFire:

Our team has been on the swerve journey over the last year and we now have it working relatively well, with the exception of a few issues like the robot consistently drifting off to the right slightly while driving forward, which we’re looking into.

I am having this same issue

PathplannerLib 2024 MK4i L2 w/ CTRE Swerve

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked:
To learn more about pathplanner, I’d highly recommend viewing other TEAM’s github and looking how they implement it. There are many great OA threads with plenty of public code to look over. Here are a few:

8088 - Bionic Panthers (shameless self-promotion)

4481 - Rembrandts

Forgot what TEAM this was (sorry)

I think this is 8598 - ElectroKnights

Going over different codes like the above will definitely bolster your knowledge of how pathplanner is implemented with different teams.

This may be similar to what you are experiencing. There could be many reasons why your bot is drifting, but make sure to test them sequentially, and to triple check all 4 modules are the same. (In both your hardware client and code)

Hope this helps

Edit: Make sure you have all your constraints/data/settings in pathplanner properly configured image 800×422 16.5 KB

image 800×422 16.5 KB

image 800×422 16.5 KB

Swerve Drive Modules now drifting/veering during straight movements

posts.cooked:
Xactlysharp:

To learn more about pathplanner, I’d highly recommend viewing other TEAM’s github and looking how they implement it. There are many great OA threads with plenty of public code to look over.

Thank you. I notice on the 8088 - Bionic Panthers code that there are some paths in the deploy directory but I didn’t see PathPlanner used in the code, rather I saw trajectories manually in the sDrive command file. It is better to start by making trajectories manually before going into PathPlanner? I assumed that PathPlanner is better due to it’s apparent user-friendliness, especially in the 2024 updates.

Xactlysharp:

This may be similar to what you are experiencing. There could be many reasons why your bot is drifting, but make sure to test them sequentially, and to triple check all 4 modules are the same. (In both your hardware client and code)

That could be the issue, I think however it might be due to our wheels. They are suffering damage after driving them through one competition and down several blocks of a road for a parade. I just included that issue in this thread incase it is somehow connected to the PathPlanner issue.

posts.name: Anderson Hall
posts.cooked:
SirFire:

paths in the deploy directory but I didn’t see PathPlanner used in the code

Before we used PathPlanner, we looked into creating our own trajectories, that’s what the sDrive command is. Our PathPlanner code is in our drive subsystem, shown in the image below (line ~100) image 1071×577 35.9 KB I go into detail on how the commands work in my TEAM’s OA thread. (Also shameless self promotion)

image 1071×577 35.9 KB

image 1071×577 35.9 KB

SirFire:

might be due to our wheels.

Wheel damage would likely cause something like the issue you are describing Especially if you drove your bot several blocks for a parade.

I’d recommend not creating your own trajectories before using PathPlanner. If you want to learn more about trajectories and path following, go ahead, but it is by no means required, especially thanks to PathPlanner’s great UI.
